title: Rihanna Unveils Cover Art and Title of New Album
text:
Comments The Barbadian beauty announces her upcoming eighth studio album will be called 'Anti'. 
While not having set a date for her new album, Rihanna is teasing the project by revealing its cover art and title. Teaming up with Israeli artist Roy Nachum who designed the artwork, she debuted the album's cover at Los Angeles' Mama Gallery on Wednesday night, October 7. The cover features an image of young Rihanna holding a balloon with a gold crown covering her eyes. A poem by Chloe Mitchell is written in Braille over the red-and-white canvas cover. It, of course, reflects the album's theme as Rihanna said, "Sometimes the ones who have sight are the blindest." A photo posted by Teboho George (@tebohogeorge) on Oct 7, 2015 at 8:47pm PDT A photo posted by Teboho George (@tebohogeorge) on Oct 7, 2015 at 8:53pm PDT Rihanna gushed about the artwork, "This is my favorite album cover I've ever done." She also revealed that her upcoming eighth studio album would be called "Anti". A photo posted by Teboho George (@tebohogeorge) on Oct 7, 2015 at 8:55pm PDT "Anti" will be RiRi's first full-length since 2012's " Unapologetic ". To preview her new album, she has released "FourFiveSeconds" featuring Kanye West and Sir Paul McCartney , "B**ch Better Have My Money" and "American Oxygen".
